title: Please can Skarner get a little love
body: I played Skarner tons before the rework, then when he was reworked I played him even more. He is my highest mastery champ. I have 2 skins for him and want to continue him as my main. Despite my love for skarner currently in my opinion he is just a fraction of what he used to be. Ever since the rework he has received nothing but nerfs....JUST NERFS. I would specify but what would be the point if you read the patch history for skarner its literally littered with the word "reduced". With the nerfing of Gauntlet and the price increase for Cinderhaulk he needs it more then ever. All im saying is if VAYNE can get a buff my boy Skar can get a lil mini buff PLEASE. I WILL DO ANYTHING.

replies.body:
Realistically, Skarner doesn't need a buff, and he shouldn't get one. He's stronger than average, and even manages to make a couple appearances in pro play despite being part of the champion class least suited to pro play. By any measure, he's a good champion.

His problem isn't balance. It's that he's boring as hell because his design is fucked 6 ways to Sunday. Riot has messed with him without actually trying to make him work for years, and he's paying for it. What he needs desperately is a full gameplay update, instead of just the 1 ability reworks Riot has thrown at him over the years. He won't get it, because nobody gives a fuck about Skarner (particularly Riot), but that's what he actually needs instead of just a meaningless buff.

Then again, I guess there's no reason we couldn't buff him. So long as he's not the most OP thing in the game, I don't anyone actually cares what his balance state is. No one is really going to care if a Skarner rolls them so long as they only see Skarner once a year anyway. They might as well just let the 5 of us who play him enjoy an OP champion.

Doesn't need a buff?
He has received nothing but nerfs since rework. This partnered with item nerfs has rendered him in the worst state he's ever been in. Boring is subjective so to each his own, but I've played 100s of games with Skarner and was never bored I love the champion and how  little he is played. Stronger then average?! Compared to what bruiser/tank? This just isn't true.

Periodic buffs to defensive items and particularly to {{item:3053}} have made Skarner stronger than most.

The main issue is that Skarner has a pathetic early game. Fantastic jungle clear (Doesn't even need pots), terrible early durability and only decent ganks. This is exasperated by the fact that the jungle does not give as much gold as a lane, so his build comes out much slower than a laner's.

But once Skarner gets 6 items, he's unstoppable. He's a much better late game Juggernaut than most, better than Darius, better than Illaoi, brings the damage of both while being more durable, faster, and having more utility, but it relies entirely on him getting 6 items. The only champions that can 1v1 a fully built Skarner are ones made to duel (Fiora, Jax, etc), and really powerful ADCs that can kite him (Vayne in particular is nasty).

{{item:3078}} {{item:3053}} {{item:3111}} {{item:1401}} {{item:3742}} {{item:3065}}
Based on what you're saying right now wouldn't this be a more then reasonable reason to nerf his early game a little?

Negative. Skarner clears the jungle faster and more healthy that just about any jungler, but the quality of his ganks is only okay, and he doesn't duel well with other junglers in the early game, particularly those who rush Warrior.

Skarner needs and is entirely built around rushing Trinity Force. I love Skarner, he's my favorite champion and I play him all the time, and it is imperative to build Trinity Force before Cinderhulk. If you rush Cinderhulk, you're a poor man's tank who has no damage. Trinity Force gives you the damage you need to do what you need to do.

And nerfing his early game would make that rush significantly more difficult, since Trinity Force is a very expensive item and the jungle is not a lucrative source of gold.

Skarner needs a buff to his mid-game more than anything else.
Lol sorry  I meant buff his early game .

Buffing his early defenses (Mostly Armor, maybe HP too) would go a long way in letting him actually duel with enemies. Nerfing his defensive scaling would make him end at the same place, so an early buff to defensive stats would be nice.
Giving him back his original passive is what's needed.

Eh. That can wait until he gets a larger update.

The spires are flawed, but the buff is not. The fact that he gets the MS and AS when he stuns someone makes a large difference, and feels good to play with. The one part where it feels bad is where you don't get the benefit of the AS when you ult someone.

You make great points, I agree with most if not all of them. Let me give a quick take on his current state. 

Overall Skarner right now is indeed very balanced and strong statistically, for mains and even newer players. Which is amazing as newer players might not optimise Skarner's kit. For anyone who is new to Skarner, a couple optimisations are as such:

* Q before autoattacking to get it off cooldown quicker.

* Try to not only flash ult, it behooves you to tag the enemy with E first (then maybe wait 1-2 seconds max), ult them back towards the team, flip them around at the last second to gain extra range, then autoattack after ult wears off (and E is still on them) to proc the stun a second time (2.75 seconds of stun/suppress). 

* Itemise heavy/max CDR. After the circumstance described above, the E is coming back up and you can tag them again from close range and stun yet again for 3.75 seconds total CC within the space of ~5 seconds. 

Needless to be said, I of course I hate the spires mini-game as compared to his previous Q which gave him stacking movespeed and attackspeed ala Udyr, which lets him choose the terms of engagement. The power being shifted to 6 zones that can be taken away is very frustrating, but all together the changes have Skarner in a very very good place. IMO his damage oriented builds with warrior into trinity scales much better, and he can health stack for a significantly better shield on W. 

However, he must hit his E and ideally build trinity or some real semblance of damage (warrior into trinity seems the choice for diamond/master Skarner mains). Iceborn is just not worth it and only for cases when the enemy is full AD and you will stack it with randuins and tabis etc. If you can't afford to build trinity 1st or 2nd item and need durability, buy sheen early and sit on that. I personally like to go black cleaver, which gives more oomph to his Q and R when compared to trinity's 25 AD. It also benefits my ADC in cases where we have no other black cleaver user. It has it's uses and I think it's worth consideration, especially since it gives you more HP and the same amount of CDR as trinity while being 700 gold cheaper.

Skarner is weakest in early game like you said, and scales really well into late game as both a damage dealer and damage absorber. Anyway sorry this has become a long blabbering post, and not necessarily for you as much as it is a general tips post. Do you have any other tips and such that I have most likely overlooked? {{champion:72}}

Doesn't necessarily make him bad. Jax hasn't ever had a straight up buff pretty much since his release (Everything has either been a bug fix, QOL changes, a power shift or just a nerf), and he's still good

>He has received nothing but nerfs since rework. 

Yeah, because he was OP as shit. He got nerfed, ended up in a balanced state, and was left alone afterwards. He's fine.

>This partnered with item nerfs has rendered him in the worst state he's ever been in

That definitely isn't true. A greater shift towards resistances, the sustained buffing of defensive items, and the introduction/buffing of specific items that help Skarner overcome his weaknesses have generally improved him, if only slightly.

Also, "worst state he's ever been in"? Come on dude. Do you remember the early days of season 3, when he was a 46% winrate urgot-level meme champion? Do you remember how bad the first rework was, and how he had to get buffed twice only to get reworked again literally 6 patches later? He's actually viable now, which we couldn't even say back then. Hell, beyond that, he's competitive, which almost no other champions in his class can say. Or to be more accurate, he would be competitive if he had anything unique that made him worth playing, but Riot decided that "generic" would be his defining design trait in the third rework, so he doesn't.

>Stronger then average?! Compared to what bruiser/tank? 

Well, he's the only immobile bruiser to see any professional play, and he strikes a better winrate, so pretty much most of them. That's what "stronger than average" means. He's not beating out a Maokai or other S-tier picks, but he's more than holding his own against everyone else.

> Boring is subjective so to each his own, 

One way to tell a champion is boring is when they feel weak and pitiful despite outperforming other champions. That's a marker of really, really unsatisfying gameplay, and it's a great reason to petition Riot to hurry up and start working on the inevitable fourth rework.

He needs a full gameplay update. He's in a balanced state, so Riot isn't going to touch him until they get time to work on that, and they've already said that a lot of other champions are ahead of him in line. All we can hope for is that they hurry the fuck up.

Realistically, he is the only champion in this entire game where the enemy can actually turn OFF his passive. How many of you would be crying if suddenly Yasou no longer got a double crit shield? Or if Akali/Nasus no longer passively healed from damage.

>Realistically, he is the only champion in this entire game where the enemy can actually turn OFF his passive.

I don't see the point you're trying to make. This was just as true back when he was a 70% winrate monstrosity. It says nothing about his balance state one way or the other.

As I see it, that's a design problem, not a balance one, and I'm already arguing that his design is godawful. He's perfectly strong, but he desperately needs a rework because of shitty, frustrating, unsatisfying design.
My point is he was perfectly fine before they removed his passive completely. It only works in 6 areas of the map? That's insulting.

>My point is he was perfectly fine before they removed his passive completely

I wouldn't agree that he was perfectly fine before that (his design has been fucked since the removal of his permaslow), but I do agree that adding the spires was a major step backwards and should have never happened.
Agreed, I would love a total revamp to his original build. I don't care if his E slow/stuns. Bring back his E heal, Q perma slow, and W attack speed.

I only think that Skarner needs the juggernaut changes reverted. There are a few different tweaks that could be made from there, but the pre-juggernaut skarner was by far the most fun version of the scorpion to play.

If skarner was strong he'd have significantly higher playrate, TTL for instance skarner is actually the meta pick as he's reliable with his passive spires being in very good spots (one particularly in lane). 

The issue is on rift, skarner is just super unreliable and there is no reason to pick the champion even when he is strong. Sure he can duel everyone and their mother in his spires, *when he's in his spires.*

Sure he can become a late game monster with items, *if he reaches late game.*

Its the same discomfort players have with kindred, their system is hit or miss and like skarner he's a hit or miss champion where you either feel like there's nothing you can do or you feel in complete control of the game. Kindred feels great to play!... with marks.. if you get them and the enemy jungler isn't an asshole from your perspective, but in reality they're just good and you lose comfort in your draft decision. 

Skarner same issue.. dueling the enemy is great in your spires but that's if they're not in complete control of the map with better ganks/counter ganks and have your spires and camps with them. If you pick skarner and turns out all your spires are down or you're just being kited all game and can't do much outside flash R, then you begin to feel the champion wasn't the right decision over how you're playing it since options seem lackluster. 

No matter how meta skarner is, you almost will never want to pick him over {{champion:120}} since its easier and more reliable to be consistently strong or productive on a hecarim where as skarner needs a lot more risk for that reward. Evidence by the trinity force update last season where skarner was actually sleeper op but still hecarim made him unviable.

Personally I'd just like if riot added spires in better locations or made a passive where you could "activate one spire at a time", similar to how kindred can pick a target to mark, skarner could warn the enemy laner he's preping to come gank if the spire in their lane goes live for his buffs, this would open up to more locations he can setup his spires and fight in.

>If skarner was strong he'd have significantly higher playrate

No he wouldn't. He's an immobile bruiser with no interesting unique mechanics. He won't be popular unless he's the strongest thing in the game. He's not, so he's unpopular. Above average is just ignorable for Skarner.

We have and have had plenty of champions who are strong, but still have very low playrates. This can be due to a niche audience, or just boring, insipid champion design. Skarner is the latter. If you want an example of the former, check out Aurelion Sol.

>The issue is on rift, skarner is just super unreliable and there is no reason to pick the champion even when he is strong.

You have the right idea, but this isn't really the right wording. Skarner's problem isn't unreliability. He has very reliable outcomes, particularly since Skarners play expecting to never get use out of their shrines. His problem is a lack of agency and control. You get very reliable outcomes, but those outcomes are limited by Skarner's immobility combined with his need to stick to enemies makes him frustrating. There is very little that makes Skarner.

You even express this very well with this quote "their system is hit or miss and like skarner he's a hit or miss champion where you either feel like there's nothing you can do or you feel in complete control of the game." This isn't unreliability. It's a lack of agency. Skarner doesn't get influence over whether he succeeds or not. Either the enemy has high mobility kiting heroes with peel and fuck Skarner, or they don't and he can fight. Either Skarner's enemies are stupid enough to fight in the spires, or he never uses them. Skarner doesn't choose. Skarner is just along for the ride, because nothing in his kit gives him influence over the game or any way to alter his play. 

Even though the average of these outcomes comes out to "above-average" in strength, people don't like it because they don't feel they're making choices with Skarner. Everything that happens with Skarner is very reliable, and very little of what you do as a player influences it. That's why his design is so terrible.

>Evidence by the trinity force update last season where skarner was actually sleeper op but still hecarim made him unviable.

Hecarim didn't affect Skarner's viability at all. Skarner was perfectly viable. Hell, he's pretty much just better than Hecarim right now. The reason don't play Skarner and won't play Skarner is that Skarner is so boring that you'd rather be doing something else with your time. Whenever Skarner isn't so good that he's a must-play, he'll be unpopular.

>Personally I'd just like if riot added spires in better locations 

I very strongly disagree. I don't want Riot to waste more time on small reworks that don't accomplish anything. They've been doing that since season 4, and it needs to stop. They could implement your proposed changes today, and by next patch he'd be the least-played champion in the game again. Nothing would be accomplished, because the spires are boring, the reward they give is a boring way to implement a reward, and the rest of his kit is boring around them.

He needs a full rework. He needs the spires scrapped. He needs his Q to have a reason to exist beyond effectively being a damage aura that procs triforce. He needs his E reworked, because there is no reason why an immobile bruiser should have 100% of his success tied up into hitting a linear pass-through skillshot. That's the most generic mechanic in the game. They need to decide whether they want to really design his kit around his ultimate, or if they want him functional outside of it. He needs something that actually makes him interesting to play.

Personally I don't feel like Skarner is a jungle fighter anymore. He has to reach level 6 to be effective thus allowing plenty of other more advantageous choices for pre 6 gank champions. I've been playing him top lane for the last 3 years now because he has much more lane control and gank set ups than he does as a jungler. Additionally, Skarner in lane makes him dive proof. So you have 3 really nice aspects as opposed to a "wait, I'm not 6 yet" jungler.
Sorry mate, but unless you're one of the 20 "flavor of the season" champs, you get no love

Skarner's problem is that he doesn't have a strategic identity. 

You pick Zac for the initiation and knockups

You pick Amumu for the wombo-combos

You pick Lee-Sin for early ganks.

But I just can't think of anything you'd pick Skarner for. He's sort of a jack-of-all trades that does everything very mediocre. All he has is his ult really. He used to be a scrappy and sticky duelist. Everything Skarner can do, there are other champs that does it better than him

Fact of the matter is, Skarner is Riot's most neglected champs. ALL the champs have gotten some of attention, whether it be new skins, Mordekaiser appearing in the Pentakill video, Volibear appearing in Ornn's story, Udyr getting a mini-rework etc. But Skarner, he doesn't exist more or less. The jugg rework ruined him. I think Riot might as well just delete Skarner from the game.

I think his identity is pretty clear.  He's the late-game juggernaut hypercarry.  I'd almost say he accomplishes that better than Nasus, but Nasus just got buffed pretty well and the one thing Skarner always lacked from other bruiser/juggernauts is innate healing. 


Of course this then illicits the obvious flaw with that identity being you REALLY don't want that type of champion as your jungler.  The meta right now is mostly early game junglers, but even from older metas, junglers were never meta if they needed to wait until lvl 16+ and/or 3+ items to be relevant and then dumpster people.  Even old Devourer enchantment and Lantern builds for junglers thrived mostly in mid game (although on the late end of mid game), because they would still die before they got in range of fully built ADC's and APC's.

But Skarner really needs a minimum of 3 items and boots to feel effective, unless he's fed.  But you will still likely either die too quickly for an immobile melee with no tank item, or do practically no damage as an easily kite-able champ who's looking for picks with his Ult.

Skarner only needs 1 real change, imo.

Make him AA the target of his ultimate.

There's some other useful stuff that would help (Removing the useless 'charge up' mechanic on his Q, more base defenses for less scaling defense so he's the same late, better in early), but that one change would make Skarner significantly better.

Im not asking for a complete overhaul or anything but just a little love. This is a great idea but I think the perfect fix would be to return his MS back to 345 and buff his E's slow and damage not completely to what it was somewhere in-between. This would increase stickiness negating the gauntlet nerf a little and increase damage output, considering that they nerfed his ult ad ratio to 60% from 100%.

Skarner is plenty sticky, especially with Dead Man's Plate, but a buff to the scaling damage of his E would be nice. I think making him AA his ult target would solve any damage problem he has, though.
He used to be stickier, but Riot killed that; even though that was their initial intention of Skarner to begin with, a low damage, stick to you like glue harass demon.

I am fine with not doing much dmg early but at least have means to get in range for E would be good. Perhaps give E empowered AA extra range like wukong Q and he is fine.
